intro: Callostylis benchaii, commonly known as the Benchai's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its small, spike-like inflorescences produce tiny, pale blue to white flowers. Callostylis benchaii is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
